intro: Litsea wushanica, commonly known as the Wushan litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically the Wushan Mountains in the Sichuan province. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small drupes, typically containing a single seed. Litsea wushanica is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
